Some of our District Office staff (including Treasurer Ryan Jenkins and Exec. Director of Special Projects Bob Blackburn) helped the Amazon team unload eight pallets full of items including:

180 bottles of gallon hand sanitizer

240 bottles of spray disinfectant

72,000 different types of disinfectant wipes

13,000 napkins

26,000 dry wipes

We can't thank Amazon enough for being such a generous and thoughtful community partner!

The Pickerington Local School District is taking steps to understand and support the district’s diversity, equity, and inclusion needs. The Board of Education is soliciting feedback from residents of the district through a short survey.

Following this survey, the Board of Education will appoint a Citizens’ Action Committee (CAC) to work with it and a contracted facilitator to evaluate our district’s practices and provide recommendations to continue delivering education that respects students and district residents. Residents interested in serving on the CAC may express their interest through the survey.

The survey will be open from September 7, 2020, through September 14, 2020, and is accessible through this link: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/PLSD2020.

We appreciate your feedback and thank you in advance for taking time to complete the survey and continue our district’s quest for excellence.

post_text: Important information about the FREE school meals program: ALL students are eligible for free meals after Tuesday, Sept. 8th. ONLY those who wish to remain in the free and reduced meal program AFTER this period of free meals runs out will need to fill out a free and reduced lunch application. All other students will receive free meals until the USDA funds are exhausted. This is a temporary extension that is granted through the USDA National School Lunch Program. It will run until December 31, or until Congress runs out of funding for school food service departments. All of these applications can be found on the Food Services webpage at https://www.pickerington.k12.oh.us/food-services/. A la carte items, concessions, and coffee bars will still be available for sale and will be charged on the student's account. If you have any further questions, please call the food service office at 614-833-3645. #plsdproud

post_text: Our friends at the Pickerington Public Library are partnering with Grow With Google and the Public Library Association to present a three-part work force development series called "Get On Your Feet." The three sessions, all at 1 p.m., will focus on different aspects of employment help, including job searching on July 22, resume and interview help on July 28, and concluding with job skill acquisition on July 30. Registration is required, either online or by phone through the library. Sessions will be recorded for viewing after the live event.

We are #PLSDProud to announce our inaugural Pelotonia team!

The annual Pelotonia ride normally consists of a three-day experience that includes cycling, entertainment and volunteerism while raising funds for cancer research. This year, instead of the three-day event, participants have been challenged to set individual exercise and/or volunteer goals to complete whenever and however they wish by October 31.

Some of our team's goals are to ride 45 miles to honor three Pickerington teachers undergoing cancer treatment, ride 25 miles, ride 50 miles, ride 200 miles by August 31 and run 50 miles by August 31.

For more information on PLSD's team, please visit https://www.yourpelotonia.org/profiles/public-team-profile?userkey=4070724

Recently, our Pickerington Schools - PLSD educators received professional development training online from Catlin Tucker, a blended learning, flipped learning and remote teaching expert. The goal of these workshops was to help improve teaching skills in an online or hybrid model.

During the experience, Lakeview_JH_PLSD's Jennifer McGraner said, "What we are learning from Catlin Tucker is relevant, meaningful, and will be applicable to whatever the learning environment looks like this fall... I am appreciative of how the district is providing sustainable professional development and is supporting staff for a variety of possible learning environments."

We are thankful for these opportunities that help our educators grow and provide students with the best education possible! #PLSDProud

Our Pickerington Schools - PLSD educators are currently receiving professional development training online from Catlin Tucker, a blended learning, flipped learning and remote teaching expert. The goal of these workshops is to improve teaching skills in an online or hybrid model. The sessions consist of six 1-hour live video sessions with Catlin over a two week period.

Charlotte Kemmerer, fifth grade teacher at Toll Gate Middle School, shares her thoughts on the training... "There has already been a lot of useful information and templates for setting up the logistics of remote learning including how to organize a course syllabus, ideas for participation policies, scheduling meets and office hours, and tips for Google Classroom and a course syllabus. ALL of it is very useful and helps to incorporate best practices in a remote setting."

Thank you to Catlin for helping our teachers continue to learn and grow to give our students the best education possible! #PLSDProud

post_text: Out of space and with 1,000 more new students on the way, Pickerington Schools - PLSD's Board of Education unanimously agreed last night to move forward with placing a modest 2.9 mill bond issue on the November 3, 2020 ballot. The bond issue, if approved by voters in November, will provide funds for one new junior high school and provide renovations and security updates in others. To read more, including frequently asked questions about the bond issue, visit https://www.pickerington.k12.oh.us/news/board-of-education-approves-bond-issue-for-november-2020-ballot/ There's also tons of info here: https://www.pickerington.k12.oh.us/p4p/ If you watch the presentation video on this page it will break down, by estimated dollar amounts, the intended use of the bond funds, including building maps. We also realize that millage rates can be confused with millions of dollars, so Treasurer Ryan Jenkins is going to work on a video which explains millage rates. Look for that soon.

Pickerington Schools - PLSD added 46 new photos.
May 26 at 12:35 PM ·

The sun shined bright for our Pickerington High School North graduation ceremony! Families remained in their vehicles to snap some photos and watch their senior walk across the stage and become a PHSN alum. Many cheered, clapped and honked to celebrate this memorable moment.

While this may not have been the graduation everyone pictured at the beginning of the school year, it was one that we will always remember! Thank you to everyone who made this a special day for our seniors!

Congratulations PHSN Class of 2020! We have been and always will be #PLSDProud of you!

Enjoy these photos that embrace all the emotions of graduation! You can view more photos here: https://photos.app.goo.gl/h6cXuu16J5Mq8A6S7
